Information -> Flow -> Control

January 09, 2012

When someone shares a secret with another person, they tend to prepend the secret with "promise not to tell anyone this, but ..." and then spill the beans. When secrets are leaked out it's usually because person A tells persons B, C and D, and those people tell E, F, G ... Z. The propagation of confidential information runs like a virus, spreading out between nodes. Read more
